primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human insufficiency (economic, social, and spiritual) to the discovery of the 'allness' and completeness found in Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ can wipe away all our tears
The cross of Calvary cleanses us
He finds us in our sins
He follows the wanderer out through the darkness
full rights in the family of God
in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily
A world of hungry men may feast on Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: False Philosophy / Human Insufficiency / Sin / Death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'Death's Conqueror' and 'Grave's Spoiler', indicating a battle against ontological powers.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to find sufficiency through 'boosters', 'angels', or 'deficit spending'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human / The Colossian Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human effort) is shown to fail, necessitating the primary program (Christ's sufficiency).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Christ can wipe away all our tears.
The cross of Calvary cleanses us.
He finds us in our sins.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We may never have been burnt by fire...
People at Colossae had come to believe...

voorbeelden: Beware lest any man spoil you
The writer is addressing a problem, a dangerous idea
He is as inexhaustible at the end as he was at the beginning

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of Christ to satisfy, rather than the 'Obligation' (Devoir) of the believer to perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Insufficiency) through ~S1 (Vain Deceit) to S1 (Fullness in Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'allness' of Christ which swallows the 'not enough' of the human condition.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; insufficiency is described as a painful, systemic reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions Christ as the active Subject who provides what the human Receiver lacks. It explicitly rejects human 'boosters' and 'supplements'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: They had to be worthy, perfect, sinless in order to come to the Lord's table

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as the sole actor of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ is all we need. He finds us in our sins.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; Christ is the only figure highlighted, and he is the Actor, not the Example.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the 'Hero' (Calvary's Hero) who acts on behalf of the passive believer.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a tight focus on the theme of 'Sufficiency' from the economic introduction to the Christological conclusion.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The cross of Calvary cleanses us from all unrighteousness

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the objective work of Christ rather than the subjective work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a state of 'insufficiency' and 'lostness' requiring a 'Conqueror'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by Christ as Subject. The hearer is the beneficiary of an 'inexhaustible' gift.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-oriented goal.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as sin, death, and false philosophy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology is the foundation; ethics (implied) would follow as a response to 'completeness'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of moralism by making Christ the Subject of every transformative verb.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'insufficiency' metaphors, Greimas reveals that these metaphors serve to establish the 'Object' that only the 'Subject' (Christ) can provide.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek 'pleroma'; semiotics shows how 'pleroma' functions as the 'Object of Desire' in the narrative axis.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—moving from the failing human subject to the sufficient Christ-subject.

volledige_subject_lijst: Christ (wipe, cleanse, find, follow, kneel, write, say, come)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses economic metaphors (deficit spending) to ground the theological concept of grace in lived experience.
